content:
Kochere is a fantastic introduction to Ethiopian coffee.

Yes, Kochere is often available in a medium roast. In fact, a medium roast is a great way to bring out the balanced flavor profile of Kochere. A medium roast will accentuate the coffee's citrus and floral notes, while still maintaining a smooth and refined taste.

You can expect a medium-roasted Kochere to have a flavor profile that's balanced and nuanced, with notes of:

* Citrus (lemon, orange)
* Floral (rose, jasmine)
* Fruity (stone fruits, berries)
* Hints of chocolate and caramel

When searching for a medium-roasted Kochere, you can look for keywords like "medium roast," "balanced," "smooth," or "approachable" in the product description. Some roasters might also describe their medium-roasted Kochere as having a "honeyed" or "sweet" flavor profile.

If you're buying online, you can check the roaster's website or online marketplaces like Amazon. If you're visiting a local coffee shop or roastery, don't hesitate to ask the barista or roaster for a medium-roasted Kochere.

Some popular coffee roasters that offer a medium-roasted Kochere include:

* Intelligentsia Coffee
* Stumptown Coffee Roasters
* La Colombe Coffee Roasters
* Verve Coffee Roasters
* Counter Culture Coffee

Remember, roast levels can vary between roasters, so don't be afraid to ask for a taste or a sample before committing to a purchase. Happy brewing!
